vjdbv1.0_description: GenBank Accession of the virus sequence. It equals NCBI Accession, ENA Accession, and DDBJ Accession, which are part of the INSDC.
ncbi_virus_n_field_description: A unique identifier (Nucleotide, Protein or Assembly Accession, depending on the selected tab) assigned to the sequence record in GenBank.

vjdbv1.0_description: NCBI Assembly Accession of the virus sequence.
ncbi_virus_n_field_description: NCBI Virus Assembly accession number. For more information about NCBI Virus assembly, see Data Model, Type of Data and Dataflow section.

vjdbv1.0_description: References the BioProject Accession that the virus sequence is a part of (INSDC).
ncbi_virus_n_field_description: The BioProject accession number associated with the sequence.

vjdbv1.0_description: References the BioSample Accession that the virus sequence is a part of (INSDC).
ncbi_virus_n_field_description: The BioSample accession number associated with the sequence.

vjdbv1.0_description: Date when the sample the virus sequence originates from was collected or sampled.
vjdbv1.0_notes: would be "Date" but to make distinction as there are multiple dates;
ncbi_virus_n_field_description: The date when the virus sample was collected.
ena_erc32_field_description: (Mandatory) The date the sample was collected with the intention of sequencing, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval. in case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid iso8601 compliant times: 2008-01-23t19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23t19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008.
ena_erc33_field_description: (Mandatory) The date the sample was collected with the intention of sequencing, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval. in case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid iso8601 compliant times: 2008-01-23t19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23t19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008.

vjdbv1.0_description: Country or sea area where the sample the virus sequence originates from was collected or sampled.
ncbi_virus_n_field_description: The country of specimen collection.
ncbi_virus_n_curation_notes: split Geo_Location and compare to collection_country , ingest to collection_region and collection_city
ena_erc32_field_description: (Mandatory) The geographical origin of where the sample was collected from, with the intention of sequencing, as defined by the country or sea name. country or sea names should be chosen from the insdc country list (http://insdc.org/country.html).
ena_erc33_field_description: (Mandatory) The location the sample was collected from with the intention of sequencing, as defined by the country or sea. country or sea names should be chosen from the insdc country list (http://insdc.org/country.html).

vjdbv1.0_description: Genbank title of the sequence.
ncbi_virus_n_field_description: The title of the GenBank record associated with the sequence.

vjdbv1.0_description: Determines if this virus sequence is available in Genbank.
ncbi_virus_n_field_description: Specifies if the sequence is from GenBank or RefSeq database.

vjdbv1.0_description: Determines if this virus sequence is a reference sequence in the RefSeq database.
ncbi_virus_n_field_description: Specifies if the sequence is from GenBank or RefSeq database.

vjdbv1.0_description: City where the sample the sequence originates from was collected or sampled.
ncbi_virus_n_field_description: The geographic location where the virus was isolated. NCBI Virus relies solely on the information provided by submitters, which may sometimes mistakenly identify regions where sequences were processed instead of the actual collection locations. The granularity of the information displayed in the column depends on the submitter. For example, it can be "Australia: Heron Island, Great Barrier Reef", or just "China". The country and other geographic location names are based on the INSDC Geographic Location list.
ncbi_virus_n_curation_notes: split Geo_Location and compare to collection_country , ingest to collection_region and collection_city

vjdbv1.0_description: Country name and additional identifier like a state abbreviation from where the sample the sequence originates from was collected/sampled.
ncbi_virus_n_field_description: The geographic location where the virus was isolated. NCBI Virus relies solely on the information provided by submitters, which may sometimes mistakenly identify regions where sequences were processed instead of the actual collection locations. The granularity of the information displayed in the column depends on the submitter. For example, it can be "Australia: Heron Island, Great Barrier Reef", or just "China". The country and other geographic location names are based on the INSDC Geographic Location list.
ncbi_virus_n_curation_notes: split Geo_Location and compare to collection_country , ingest to collection_region and collection_city
ena_erc32_field_description: (Recommended) The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the specific region name followed by the locality name.
ena_erc33_field_description: (Recommended) The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the specific region name followed by the locality name.

vjdbv1.0_description: Common name of the host the virus sequence was collected from, e.g. human. Currently (v1.0) no ontology is applied.
ncbi_virus_n_field_description: The host organism from which the virus was isolated. This is the submitter-provided host organism, not the full host range known for the virus. For more information, see Glossary: Host.
ena_erc32_field_description: (Mandatory) Common name of the host, e.g. human
ena_erc33_field_description: (Mandatory) Common name of the host, e.g. human

vjdbv1.0_description: Length of the virus sequence in basepairs (bp).
vjdbv1.0_notes: Is sequence in the name needed? Length to generic -> Sequence Length (consideration for other data layers);
ncbi_virus_n_field_description: Sequence length, the number of nucleotides or amino acids in the sequence.

vjdbv1.0_description: Molecule type of the sequence, e.g. ssRNA. Note that there are 15 molecule types corresponding to combinations of the Baltimore Classifications, from NCBI GenBank.
vjdbv1.0_notes: Should be curated into Baltimore classes; Is this a sequence attribute or sample or both? Represent in naming?;
ncbi_virus_n_field_description: Genome molecule type, type of viral nucleic acid, as provided by ICTV. For more information, see Glossary: Genome Molecule Type.

vjdbv1.0_description: Whether the sequence is a partial or complete sequence in NCBI GenBank,  "Nuc_Completeness" from NCBI Virus
ncbi_virus_n_field_description: Indicates if the nucleotide sequence is complete or partial. Nucleotide sequences are considered complete, if they were submitted as such to GenBank or other INSDC databases. For more information, see Glossary: Nucleotide Completeness.

vjdbv1.0_description: The level of the sequence completeness compare to the representative sequence in refseq in percentage
NCBI GenBank organism name: a taxonomic name at species level or below the species level.
vjdbv1.0_notes: technically sample species or below, take as it is until curation;
ncbi_virus_n_field_description: Gen Bank organism name, a taxonomic name at species level or below the species level.

vjdbv1.0_description: Organization the submitter(s) is(are) affiliated with.
ncbi_virus_n_field_description: Organization or institution the sequence submitters affiliated with, as well as country or location of the organization.
ncbi_virus_n_curation_notes: may need to split Organization to submitter_region
vjdb_example: National Center for Biotechnology Information, NIH

vjdbv1.0_description: Date when the sequence was made public in a repository (e.g. GenBank, BV-BRC).
ncbi_virus_n_field_description: The date when the sequence was released in the GenBank.

vjdbv1.0_description: Name of the virus segment. Can be a number.
ncbi_virus_n_field_description: Segment name or number representing a genome segment. For more information, see Clossary: Segment.

vjdbv1.0_description: NCBI Sequence Read Archive (SRA) Accession.
ncbi_virus_n_field_description: NCBI Sequence Read Archive (SRA) accession number.

vjdbv1.0_description: Name(s) of the submitter(s) of the virus sequence.
ncbi_virus_n_field_description: Authors who submitted the sequences.

vjdbv1.0_description: Tissue, Specimen or Source of the superhost from which the sample the virus sequence originates from was collected or sampled.
vjdbv1.0_notes: Plan about sources and vocabularies, RKI different from ENA, what about NCBI and environmental, leave it like that for now with NCBi input;
ncbi_virus_n_field_description: Isolation source, part of the host organism, where the sample was obtained. For more information, see Glossary: Tissue/Specimen/Source.
ncbi_virus_n_curation_notes: split Tissue_Specimen_Source to collection_source_environment and collection_source_host_tissue
ena_erc32_field_description: (Recommended) Name of host tissue or organ sampled for analysis. example: tracheal tissue
ena_erc33_field_description: (Recommended) Name of host tissue or organ sampled for analysis. example: tracheal tissue

vjdbv1.0_description: State/Region where the sample the sequence originates from was collected/sampled.
vjdbv1.0_notes: This is defined different from the duplicate below. Meaning for submission Tool was to have a geographical level higher than countries (continents). We keep it (mostly redundant), might be useful for later curation;
ncbi_virus_n_field_description: The name of US state, if sample was collected in USA.

vjdbv1.0_description: ENA analysis object Accession.
The level of the Assembly (contig, scaffold, chromosome, complete genome).
vjdbv1.0_notes: apply customization to vjdb , e.g. chromosome to genome or something; input not yet defined

vjdbv1.0_description: Minimum length of consecutive Ns to be considered a gap.
The program used for genome assembly.
Identifier on how to treat the submitted assembly. Currently only assemblies from ‘clone or isolate’ are permitted.
vjdbv1.0_notes: for submission this is always "clone or isolate";

vjdbv1.0_description: Accession of the sequence in the BV-BRC database.
vjdbv1.0_changes: Change id and name to BVBRC_genome_id

vjdbv1.0_description: Name of the institution/affiliation to which the person collecting the sample belongs
vjdbv1.0_notes: conform with submitter organization; not sure
ena_erc32_field_description: (Mandatory) Name of the institution to which the person collecting the specimen belongs. format: institute name, institute address
ena_erc33_field_description: (Mandatory) Name of the institution to which the person collecting the specimen belongs. format: institute name, institute address

vjdbv1.0_description: Health state of the host at the time of sample collection, e.g. diseased or healthy
ena_erc32_field_description: (Mandatory) Health status of the host at the time of sample collection.
ena_erc33_field_description: (Mandatory) Health status of the host at the time of sample collection.

vjdbv1.0_description: The geographic location by latitude, where the sample the sequence originates from was collected/sampled. (DD)
ena_erc32_field_description: (Recommended) The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude. the values should be reported in decimal degrees and in wgs84 system (Units: DD)
ena_erc33_field_description: (Recommended) The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude. the values should be reported in decimal degrees and in wgs84 system Units:

vjdbv1.0_description: The geographic location by longitude, where the sample the sequence originates from was collected/sampled. (DD)
ena_erc32_field_description: (Recommended) The geographical origin of the sample as defined by longitude. the values should be reported in decimal degrees and in wgs84 system (Units: DD)
ena_erc33_field_description: (Recommended) The geographical origin of the sample as defined by longitude. the values should be reported in decimal degrees and in wgs84 system Units:

vjdbv1.0_description: Continent where the sample the sequence originates from was collected/sampled.
vjdbv1.0_notes: Region unclear -> Check again where it came from, recheck naming and vocabulary, INSDC country list contains the oceans; Name suggestions macroregion or georegion; no direct source but constructable (group countries into clusters);

vjdbv1.0_description: Describes the physical, environmental or local geographical source of the sample, e.g. soil
vjdbv1.0_notes: as it is, for revision with data; not sure
ncbi_virus_n_curation_notes: split Tissue_Specimen_Source to collection_source_environment and collection_source_host_tissue
ena_erc32_field_description: (Recommended) Describes the physical, environmental and/or local geographical source of the biological sample from which the sample was derived. example: soil
ena_erc33_field_description: (Recommended) Describes the physical, environmental and/or local geographical source of the biological sample from which the sample was derived. example: soil

vjdbv1.0_description: Name of the person that collected the sample
ena_erc32_field_description: (Mandatory) Name of the person who collected the specimen. example: john smith
ena_erc33_field_description: (Mandatory) Name of the person who collected the specimen. example: john smith

vjdbv1.0_description: The cuttoff used to determine if the sample is seropositive.
ena_erc32_field_description: (Recommended) The cut off value used by an investigatior in determining that a sample was seropositive.
ena_erc33_field_description: (Recommended) The cut off value used by an investigatior in determining that a sample was seropositive.

vjdbv1.0_description: References an ENA assembly to an ENA Experiment.
Natural behaviour of the associated host.
ena_erc32_field_description: (Recommended) Natural behaviour of the host.
ena_erc33_field_description: (Recommended) Natural behaviour of the host.

vjdbv1.0_description: The hosts main disease diagnosis.
The hosts disease outcome. Did the host recover from the disease?
ena_erc32_field_description: (Recommended) Disease outcome in the host.
ena_erc33_field_description: (Recommended) Disease outcome in the host.

vjdbv1.0_description: The symptoms that have been reported in relation to the illness, such as cough, diarrhea, fever, headache, malaise, myalgia, nausea, runny_nose, shortness_of_breath, sore_throat. If multiple exposures are applicable, please state them separated by semicolon.
The host's broader group association in a taxonomic context from BV-BRC.
Natural habitat of the avian or mammalian host
ena_erc32_field_description: (Recommended) Natural habitat of the avian or mammalian host.
ena_erc33_field_description: (Recommended) Natural habitat of the avian or mammalian host.

vjdbv1.0_description: BVBRC Lab Host, common name of the lab host.
vjdbv1.0_notes: remove? Lab Passage 1 to 1 in public and rest in private for submission, because Lab Passaged is buil on "/labhost", to catch this we provide these fields; not sure

vjdbv1.0_description: The NCBI Taxonomy ID of the lab host.
The scientific species name of the lab host.
The species name of the host associated with the virus sequence.
bv-brc_b_curation_notes: they are not all scientific names
ena_erc32_field_description: (Mandatory) Scientific name of the natural (as opposed to laboratory) host to the organism from which sample was obtained.
ena_erc33_field_description: (Mandatory) Scientific name of the natural (as opposed to laboratory) host to the organism from which sample was obtained.

vjdbv1.0_description: The host sequence NCBI Taxonomy ID. Can be based on the mapping by GTDB of the GTDB Species Name to the NCBI Taxonomy ID.
ena_erc33_field_description: (Optional) Scientific name of the laboratory host used to propagate the source organism from which the sample was obtained

vjdbv1.0_description: Sex of the associated host from the BV-BRC.
ena_erc32_field_description: (Mandatory) Gender or sex of the host.
ena_erc33_field_description: (Mandatory) Gender or sex of the host.

vjdbv1.0_description: The unique ID of the associated host from the BV-BRC.
ena_erc32_field_description: (Mandatory) A unique identifier by which each subject can be referred to, de-identified, e.g. #131
ena_erc33_field_description: (Mandatory) A unique identifier by which each subject can be referred to, de-identified, e.g. #131

vjdbv1.0_description: Method used to assess if a sample is flu positive/negative. Multiple methods are seperated by semicolon(s).
ena_erc32_field_description: (Mandatory) Method by which the current assessment of a sample as flu positive/negative is made. if multiple test were performed, please state them separated by semicolon. example: rt-pcr; antigen elisa

vjdbv1.0_description: Result of the given methods. Positive(P) or Negative(N). For multiple test the results are delimited by semicolon, e.g. P; P.
ena_erc32_field_description: (Mandatory) Classification of a sample as flu positive or negative based on the test performed and reported. if multiple tests were performed, please state the results in the same order in which you reported the tests in the field 'influenza test method'. format: p(ositive)/n(egative). example: p; p

vjdbv1.0_description: Influenza virus type classification: A, B or C.
ena_erc32_field_description: (Recommended) One of the three influenza virus classification types.

vjdbv1.0_description: Flag indicating if this virus sequence is available in BV-BRC.
The test result for other tested pathogens given as described by influenza test result.
ena_erc32_field_description: (Mandatory) Classification of a sample as positive or negative based on the test performed and reported. if tests for multiple pathogenic organisms were performed, please state the results in the same order in which you reported the tests in the field 'other pathogens tested'. format: p(ositive)/n(egative)/not applicable. example: n

vjdbv1.0_description: Was the sample tested for other pathogens? Insert the pathogenic organisms using semicolon as a delimiter, e.g. Newcastle. “None” is also valid.
ena_erc32_field_description: (Mandatory) Classification of pathogenic organisms other than influenza virus tested in the current assessment of a sample. if multiple tests were performed, please state them separated by semicolon. if no other pathogens test was performed, please state 'none'. example: newcastle

vjdbv1.0_description: Lineage determined by Pangolin.
vjdbv1.0_notes: depends on how to treat RKI data, they have pangolin leange in json format that includes version and also method information, we could either include that (bad readabiliy, or splt the relevant information for these fields)

vjdbv1.0_description: Pangolin version used to determine the lineage.
If the sample was only received and not collected provide the receipt date.
ena_erc32_field_description: (Recommended) Date on which the sample was received. format:yyyy-mm-dd. please provide the highest precision possible. if the sample was received by the institution and not collected, the 'receipt date' must be provided instead. either the 'collection date' or 'receipt date' must be provided. if available, provide both dates.
ena_erc33_field_description: (Recommended) Date on which the sample was received. format:yyyy-mm-dd. please provide the highest precision possible. if the sample was received by the institution and not collected, the 'receipt date' must be provided instead. either the 'collection date' or 'receipt date' must be provided. if available, provide both dates.

vjdbv1.0_description: RKI Accession of the virus sequence.
References a ENA assembly to an ENA Run object.
The virus species NCBI Taxonomy ID.
ena_erc32_field_description: (Mandatory) Ncbi taxonomy identifier. this is appropriate for individual organisms and some environmental samples.
ena_erc33_field_description: (Mandatory) Ncbi taxonomy identifier. this is appropriate for individual organisms and some environmental samples.

vjdbv1.0_description: Serological variety of a species characterised by its antigenic properties, e.g. H1N1.
vjdbv1.0_notes: NCBI Virus has genotype, which includes Serotype, otherwise we have no valid informational source -> internal for now;
ena_erc32_field_description: (Recommended) Serological variety of a species characterised by its antigenic properties. for influenza, ha subtype should be the letter h followed by a number between 1-16 unless novel subtype is identified and the na subtype should be the letter n followed by a number between 1-9 unless novel subtype is identified. if only one of the subtypes have been tested then use the format h5nx or hxn1. example: h1n1
ena_erc33_field_description: (Recommended) Serological variety of a species characterised by its antigenic properties. for influenza, ha subtype should be the letter h followed by a number between 1-16 unless novel subtype is identified and the na subtype should be the letter n followed by a number between 1-9 unless novel subtype is identified. if only one of the subtypes have been tested then use the format h5nx or hxn1. example: h1n1

vjdbv1.0_description: Common abbreviations of the virus species name.
Temporary NCBI Tax ID used for mapping the taxonomy tree to the metadata table.
vjdbv1.0_notes: No mapping, seems to  be NCBI Tax ID; not sure

vjdbv1.0_description: Average sequencing depth across the sequence from BVBRC.
Percentage of G and C nucleotides in the sequence from BVBRC.
Percentage of Ns within the whole sequence from BVBRC.
migs-vi_field_id: compl_score; only half of the definition is used
vjdbv1.0_changes: remove; change the name and id: sequence_perc_N

vjdbv1.0_description: Generic name of the sequence (Name of the entry).
bv-brc_b_curation_notes: change name; keep private; compare to Organism Name from NCBI Virus

vjdbv1.0_description: Number of contigs in the sequence.
The DOI of the publication associated with the sequence.
The PubMed ID of publication associated with the sequence.
vjdbv1.0_notes: needs curation before public; no example needed
bv-brc_b_curation_notes: multiple; to curate (compare with the number of pubs with ncbi virus)

vjdbv1.0_description: Last update date of the sequence in BVBRC (whole entry).
vjdbv1.0_changes: update definition: last update date of the record in bvbrc)

vjdbv1.0_description: Version of the sequence (whole entry).
Institution that sequenced the collected sample.
Insert size for paired reads.
ena_erc32_field_description: (Optional) Insert size for paired reads
ena_erc33_field_description: (Optional) Insert size for paired reads

vjdbv1.0_description: Instrument model used for sequencing.
ena_erc32_field_description: (Mandatory) Model of the sequencing instrument.
ena_erc33_field_description: (Mandatory) Model of the sequencing instrument.

vjdbv1.0_description: The protocol used to construct the sequencing library.
ena_erc32_field_description: (Optional) Free form text describing the protocol by which the sequencing library was constructed.
ena_erc33_field_description: (Optional) Free form text describing the protocol by which the sequencing library was constructed.

vjdbv1.0_description: The design of the sequencing library including details of how it was constructed.
ena_erc32_field_description: (Mandatory) Goal and setup of the individual library including library was constructed.
ena_erc33_field_description: (Optional) Goal and setup of the individual library including library was constructed.

vjdbv1.0_description: The sequencing library layout specifies whether to expect single or paired configuration of reads.
ena_erc32_field_description: (Mandatory) Library_layout specifies whether to expect single, paired, or other configuration of reads. in the case of paired reads, information about the relative distance and orientation is specified.
ena_erc33_field_description: (Mandatory) Library_layout specifies whether to expect single, paired, or other configuration of reads. in the case of paired reads, information about the relative distance and orientation is specified.

vjdbv1.0_description: The name for the sequencing library if any.
ena_erc32_field_description: (Optional) The submitter's name for this library.
ena_erc33_field_description: (Optional) The submitter's name for this library.

vjdbv1.0_description: The method used to select for or against, enrich, or screen the material being sequenced.
ena_erc32_field_description: (Mandatory) Method used to enrich the target in the sequence library preparation
ena_erc33_field_description: (Mandatory) Method used to enrich the target in the sequence library preparation

vjdbv1.0_description: The library source specifies the type of source material that is being sequenced.
ena_erc32_field_description: (Mandatory) The library_source specifies the type of source material that is being sequenced.
ena_erc33_field_description: (Mandatory) The library_source specifies the type of source material that is being sequenced.

vjdbv1.0_description: The sequencing technique intended for this sequencing library.
ena_erc32_field_description: (Mandatory) Sequencing technique intended for this library.
ena_erc33_field_description: (Mandatory) Sequencing technique intended for this library.

vjdbv1.0_description: Instrument platform used for sequencing the virus; multiple values are seperated by a semicolon (only for assemblies).
ena_erc32_field_description: (Mandatory) The platform record selects which sequencing platform and platform-specific runtime parameters. this will be determined by the center. optional if 'instrument_model' is provided.
ena_erc33_field_description: (Mandatory) The platform record selects which sequencing platform and platform-specific runtime parameters. this will be determined by the center. optional if 'instrument_model' is provided.

vjdbv1.0_description: Why was the collected sample sequenced?
The name of the source database or tool by which the virus sequence was added in VirJenDB; in the case of PhiSpy-predicted prophages, the value is PhiSpy.
vjdbv1.0_changes: change id and name to source_metadata_db, update definition

vjdbv1.0_description: Country of the submitter's organization.
Region or location of the organization of the submitters.
ncbi_virus_n_curation_notes: may need to split Organization to submitter_region

vjdbv1.0_description: Unique identifier of the virus sequence, assigned by VirJenDB.
Version of the virus sequence record, including metadata, assigned by VirJenDB.
Unique ID given by the investigator as strain might not be unique.
ena_erc32_field_description: (Recommended) Unique laboratory identifier assigned to the virus by the investigator. strain name is not sufficient since it might not be unique due to various passsages of the same virus. format: up to 50 alphanumeric characters
ena_erc33_field_description: (Recommended) Unique laboratory identifier assigned to the virus by the investigator. strain name is not sufficient since it might not be unique due to various passsages of the same virus. format: up to 50 alphanumeric characters

vjdbv1.0_description: Antiviral treatment used for this subject, such as zanamavir oseltamivir, amantadine.
ena_erc32_field_description: (Optional) Antiviral treatment used for this subject, such as zanamavir oseltamivir, amantadine. example: rimantadine

vjdbv1.0_description: Dosage of the treatment taken by the subject. example: 0.05 mg.
ena_erc32_field_description: (Optional) Dosage of the treatment taken by the subject. example: 0.05 mg

vjdbv1.0_description: Duration of antiviral treatment after onset of clinical symptoms in days.example: 5.
ena_erc32_field_description: (Optional) Duration of antiviral treatment after onset of clinical symptoms in days.example: 5

vjdbv1.0_description: Initiation of antiviral treatment after onset of clinical symptoms in days. example: 2.5.
ena_erc32_field_description: (Optional) Initiation of antiviral treatment after onset of clinical symptoms in days. example: 2.5

vjdbv1.0_description: The run data file model.
ena_erc32_field_description: (Mandatory) The run data file model.
ena_erc33_field_description: (Mandatory) The run data file model.

vjdbv1.0_description: The name or relative pathname of a run data file.
ena_erc32_field_description: (Mandatory) The name or relative pathname of a run data file.
ena_erc33_field_description: (Mandatory) The name or relative pathname of a run data file.

vjdbv1.0_description: Whether or not the subject is gravid. if so, report date due or date post-conception and specify which of these two dates is being reported.
ena_erc32_field_description: (Optional) Whether or not the subject is gravid. if so, report date due or date post-conception and specify which of these two dates is being reported.
ena_erc33_field_description: (Optional) Whether or not the subject is gravid. if so, report date due or date post-conception and specify which of these two dates is being reported.

vjdbv1.0_description: Was the subject confined to a hospital as a result of virus infection or problems occurring secondary to virus infection?
ena_erc32_field_description: (Optional) Was the subject confined to a hospital as a result of virus infection or problems occurring secondary to virus infection?
ena_erc33_field_description: (Optional) Was the subject confined to a hospital as a result of virus infection or problems occurring secondary to virus infection?

vjdbv1.0_description: Other descriptive information relating to the host.
ena_erc32_field_description: (Optional) Other descriptive information relating to the host.
ena_erc33_field_description: (Optional) Other descriptive information relating to the host.

vjdbv1.0_description: The number of days the illness lasted. example: 4
ena_erc32_field_description: (Optional) The number of days the illness lasted. example: 4
ena_erc33_field_description: (Optional) The number of days the illness lasted. example: 4

vjdbv1.0_description: Date the subject showed an onset of symptoms. format: yyyy-mm-dd. example: 2011-10-20
ena_erc32_field_description: (Optional) Date the subject showed an onset of symptoms. format: yyyy-mm-dd. example: 2011-10-20

vjdbv1.0_description: The symptoms that have been reported in relation to the illness, such as cough, diarrhea, fever, headache, malaise, myalgia, nausea, runny_nose, shortness_of_breath, sore_throat. if multiple exposures are applicable, please state them separated by semicolon.
ena_erc32_field_description: (Optional) The symptoms that have been reported in relation to the illness, such as cough, diarrhea, fever, headache, malaise, myalgia, nausea, runny_nose, shortness_of_breath, sore_throat. if multiple exposures are applicable, please state them separated by semicolon.
ena_erc33_field_description: (Optional) The symptoms that have been reported in relation to the illness, such as cough, diarrhea, fever, headache, malaise, myalgia, nausea, runny_nose, shortness_of_breath, sore_throat. if multiple exposures are applicable, please state them separated by semicolon.
vjdb_example: fever; headache; malaise; myalgia; nausea; runny_nose

vjdbv1.0_description: Unique number of the strain which is reported as a part of the influenza strain name, such as a/chicken/fujian/411/2002(hxn1). format: integer number, example: 411
ena_erc32_field_description: (Optional) Unique number of the strain which is reported as a part of the influenza strain name, such as a/chicken/fujian/411/2002(hxn1). format: integer number, example: 411

vjdbv1.0_description: Date that the influenza vaccination was administered to the subject over the past year. format: yyyy-mm-dd. example: 2007-05-12
ena_erc32_field_description: (Optional) Date that the influenza vaccination was administered to the subject over the past year. format: yyyy-mm-dd. example: 2007-05-12

vjdbv1.0_description: Influenza vaccinations that have been administered to the subject over the last year. example: 2009 h1n1 flumist
ena_erc32_field_description: (Optional) Influenza vaccinations that have been administered to the subject over the last year. example: 2009 h1n1 flumist

vjdbv1.0_name: Influenza-like Illness at the Time of Sample Collection
vjdbv1.0_description: Is the subject at the time of sample collection considered to have influenza like illness?
ena_erc32_field_name: influenza-like illness at the time of sample collection
ena_erc32_field_description: (Optional) Is the subject at the time of sample collection considered to have influenza like illness?

vjdbv1.0_description: Dose used for the inoculoation experiment.
ena_erc32_field_description: (Optional) Dose used for the inoculoation experiment.

vjdbv1.0_description: Brief description of the protocol inoculation route.
ena_erc32_field_description: (Optional) Brief description of the protocol inoculation route.

vjdbv1.0_description: Is the virus stock used for the inoculation available?
ena_erc32_field_description: (Optional) Is the virus stock used for the inoculation available?

vjdbv1.0_description: Does the h1n1 influenza virus originate from a swine-like outbreak (as opposed to a seasonal flu)?
ena_erc32_field_description: (Optional) Does the h1n1 influenza virus originate from a swine-like outbreak (as opposed to a seasonal flu)?

vjdbv1.0_description: Description helping to explain what the cut off value means.
ena_erc32_field_description: (Optional) Description helping to explain what the cut off value means.

vjdbv1.0_description: Number of host individuals inoculated for the experiment.
ena_erc32_field_description: (Optional) Number of host individuals inoculated for the experiment.

vjdbv1.0_description: Use of personal protective equipment, such as gloves, gowns, during any type of exposure. example: mask
ena_erc32_field_description: (Optional) Use of personal protective equipment, such as gloves, gowns, during any type of exposure. example: mask
ena_erc33_field_description: (Optional) Use of personal protective equipment, such as gloves, gowns, during any type of exposure. example: mask

vjdbv1.0_description: Reason for the sample collection.
ena_erc32_field_description: (Recommended) Reason for the sample collection.
ena_erc33_field_description: (Recommended) Reason for the sample collection.
vjdb_example: active surveillance in response to outbreak; market sample

vjdbv1.0_description: Conditions at which sample was stored, usually storage temperature, duration and location. in soil context: explain how and for how long the soil sample was stored before dna extraction (fresh/frozen/other).
ena_erc32_field_description: (Optional) Conditions at which sample was stored, usually storage temperature, duration and location. in soil context: explain how and for how long the soil sample was stored before dna extraction (fresh/frozen/other).
ena_erc33_field_description: (Optional) Conditions at which sample was stored, usually storage temperature, duration and location

vjdbv1.0_description: Free-form text describing the sample, its origin, and its method of isolation.
ena_erc32_field_description: (Optional) Free-form text describing the sample, its origin, and its method of isolation.
ena_erc33_field_description: (Optional) Free-form text describing the sample, its origin, and its method of isolation.

vjdbv1.0_description: Designation of information related to vaccination history as self reported or documented.
ena_erc32_field_description: (Optional) Designation of information related to vaccination history as self reported or documented.

vjdbv1.0_description: Name of the virus strain associated with the sample from which the virus sequence was obtained.
ena_erc32_field_description: (Optional) Name of the strain from which the sample was obtained.
ena_erc33_field_description: (Optional) Name of the strain from which the sample was obtained.

vjdbv1.0_description: Briefly describes the goals, purpose, and scope of the study.  this need not be listed if it can be inherited from a referenced publication.
ena_erc32_field_description: (Optional) Briefly describes the goals, purpose, and scope of the study. this need not be listed if it can be inherited from a referenced publication.
ena_erc33_field_description: (Optional) Briefly describes the goals, purpose, and scope of the study. this need not be listed if it can be inherited from a referenced publication.

vjdbv1.0_description: Exposure of the subject to infected human or animals, such as poultry, wild bird or swine. If multiple exposures are applicable, these are separated by semicolon. Example: poultry;wild bird
ena_erc32_field_description: (Optional) Exposure of the subject to infected human or animals, such as poultry, wild bird or swine. if multiple exposures are applicable, please state them separated by semicolon. example: poultry; wild bird
ena_erc33_field_description: (Optional) Exposure of the subject to infected human or animals, such as poultry, wild bird or swine. if multiple exposures are applicable, please state them separated by semicolon. example: poultry; wild bird

vjdbv1.0_description: Duration of the exposure of the subject to an infected human or animal. If multiple exposures are applicable, their duration is stated in the same order in which the exposure in the field was reported: 'subject exposure'. Example: 1 day; 0.33 days (Units: year)
ena_erc32_field_description: (Optional) Duration of the exposure of the subject to an infected human or animal. if multiple exposures are applicable, please state their duration in the same order in which you reported the exposure in the field 'subject exposure'. example: 1 day; 0.33 days (Units: year)
ena_erc33_field_description: (Optional) Duration of the exposure of the subject to an infected human or animal. if multiple exposures are applicable, please state their duration in the same order in which you reported the exposure in the field 'subject exposure'. example: 1 day; 0.33 days

vjdbv1.0_description: Clear and useful title of the study/project, e.g. a title usable for a publication or the purpose of the project and its timeframe.
ena_erc32_field_description: (Mandatory) Title of the study as would be used in a publication.
ena_erc33_field_description: (Mandatory) Title of the study as would be used in a publication.

vjdbv1.0_description: Clear and useful title to identify the sequencing experiment. This title will not be submitted to the ENA on submission.
ena_erc32_field_description: (Mandatory) Short text that can be used to call out experiment records in searches or in displays. this element is technically optional but should be used for all new records.
ena_erc33_field_description: (Optional) Short text that can be used to call out experiment records in searches or in displays. this element is technically optional but should be used for all new records.

vjdbv1.0_description: Clear and useful title to identify the sample the sequence originates from was collected/sampled. This title will not be submitted to the ENA on submission.
ena_erc32_field_description: (Mandatory) Short text that can be used to call out sample records in search results or in displays.
ena_erc33_field_description: (Mandatory) Short text that can be used to call out sample records in search results or in displays.

vjdbv1.0_description: Setting within which the subject is exposed to animals, such as farm, slaughterhouse, food preparation. if multiple exposures are applicable, please state their type in the same order in which you reported the exposure in the field 'subject exposure'. example: backyard flock; confined animal feeding operation
ena_erc32_field_description: (Optional) Setting within which the subject is exposed to animals, such as farm, slaughterhouse, food preparation. if multiple exposures are applicable, please state their type in the same order in which you reported the exposure in the field 'subject exposure'. example: backyard flock; confined animal feeding operation
ena_erc33_field_description: (Optional) Setting within which the subject is exposed to animals, such as farm, slaughterhouse, food preparation. if multiple exposures are applicable, please state their type in the same order in which you reported the exposure in the field 'subject exposure'. example: backyard flock; confined animal feeding operation
vjdb_example: backyard flock; confined animal feeding operation

vjdbv1.0_description: Dosage of the vaccine taken by the host. example: 0.05 ml
ena_erc32_field_description: (Optional) Dosage of the vaccine taken by the subject. example: 0.05 ml

vjdbv1.0_description: Lot number of the vaccine.
ena_erc32_field_description: (Optional) Lot number of the vaccine.

vjdbv1.0_description: Manufacturer of the vaccine.
ena_erc32_field_description: (Optional) Manufacturer of the vaccine.

vjdbv1.0_name: WHO/OIE/FAO Clade (Required for HPAI H5N1 Viruses)
vjdbv1.0_description: WHO/OIE/FAO clade should be included for highly pathogenic h5n1 viruses. example: 2.2
ena_erc32_field_name: WHO/OIE/FAO clade (required for HPAI H5N1 viruses)
ena_erc32_field_description: (Optional) Who/oie/fao clade should be included for highly pathogenic h5n1 viruses. example: 2.2

vjdbv1.0_description: Collection of outdated names for a particular virus.
Byte range data of the sample in the sequence file without the header
The file location of the multiseq fasta file including the parent folder name
Date of the insertion into the VirJen database
The last date the metadata was updated in the VirJen database.
A 'Realm' is the highest taxonomic rank into which virus species can be classified. Defined by the ICTV.
A 'Subrealm' is a rank in the taxonomic hierarchy into which virus species can be classified. Defined by the ICTV.
A 'Kingdom' is a rank in the taxonomic hierarchy into which virus species can be classified. Defined by the ICTV.
A 'Subkingdom' is a rank in the taxonomic hierarchy into which virus species can be classified. Defined by the ICTV.
A 'Phylum' is a rank in the taxonomic hierarchy into which virus species can be classified. Defined by the ICTV.
A 'Subphylum' is a rank in the taxonomic hierarchy into which virus species can be classified. Defined by the ICTV.
A 'Class' is a rank in the taxonomic hierarchy into which virus species can be classified. Defined by the ICTV.
A 'Subclass' is a rank in the taxonomic hierarchy into which virus species can be classified. Defined by the ICTV.
A 'Order' is a rank in the taxonomic hierarchy into which virus species can be classified. Defined by the ICTV.
A 'suborder' is a rank in the taxonomic hierarchy into which virus species can be classified. Defined by the ICTV.
A 'Family' is a rank in the taxonomic hierarchy into which virus species can be classified. Defined by the ICTV.
A 'Subfamily' is a rank in the taxonomic hierarchy into which virus species can be classified. Defined by the ICTV.
A 'Genus' is a rank in the taxonomic hierarchy into which virus species can be classified. Defined by the ICTV.
A 'Subgenus' is a rank in the taxonomic hierarchy into which virus species can be classified. Defined by the ICTV.

A Species is the lowest taxonomic rank in the hierarchy approved by the ICTV. While subspecies levels of classification may exist for some viruses (e.g. Hepatitis C virus), the ICTV does not classify viruses below the species level. Defined by the ICTV.
A 'Realm' is the highest taxonomic rank into which virus species can be classified. Defined by the NCBI.
A 'Subrealm' is a rank in the taxonomic hierarchy into which virus species can be classified. Defined by the NCBI.
A 'Kingdom' is a rank in the taxonomic hierarchy into which virus species can be classified. Defined by the NCBI.
A 'Subkingdom' is a rank in the taxonomic hierarchy into which virus species can be classified. Defined by the NCBI.
A 'Phylum' is a rank in the taxonomic hierarchy into which virus species can be classified. Defined by the NCBI.
A 'Subphylum' is a rank in the taxonomic hierarchy into which virus species can be classified. Defined by the NCBI.
A 'Class' is a rank in the taxonomic hierarchy into which virus species can be classified. Defined by the NCBI.
A 'Subclass' is a rank in the taxonomic hierarchy into which virus species can be classified. Defined by the NCBI.
A 'Order' is a rank in the taxonomic hierarchy into which virus species can be classified. Defined by the NCBI.
A 'suborder' is a rank in the taxonomic hierarchy into which virus species can be classified. Defined by the NCBI.
A 'Family' is a rank in the taxonomic hierarchy into which virus species can be classified. Defined by the NCBI.
ncbi_virus_n_field_description: Family name, as identified by NCBI Taxonomy.

vjdbv1.0_description: A 'Subfamily' is a rank in the taxonomic hierarchy into which virus species can be classified. Defined by the NCBI.
A 'Genus' is a rank in the taxonomic hierarchy into which virus species can be classified. Defined by the NCBI.
ncbi_virus_n_field_description: Genus name, as identified by NCBI Taxonomy.

vjdbv1.0_description: A 'Subgenus' is a rank in the taxonomic hierarchy into which virus species can be classified. Defined by the NCBI.

A Species is the lowest taxonomic rank in the hierarchy approved by the NCBI. While subspecies levels of classification may exist for some viruses (e.g. Hepatitis C virus), the NCBI does not classify viruses below the species level. Defined by the NCBI.
vjdbv1.0_notes: NCBI Virus has only the virus species in this field, Taxonomy Descision; no example needed
ncbi_virus_n_field_description: Species name, as defined by NCBI Taxonomy.

vjdbv1.0_description: The genotype or subtype of a virus sequence, as provided by the sequence submitter. This field comes from the "/serotype" field of the GenBank record and is shown as submitted. Consistency and accuracy may vary.
vjdbv1.0_notes: Is sample needed at all? Do we relate everything to the sequence/the virus  -> Variant, Taxonomy Decision: Variant or NCBI/ICTV Variant; no example needed
ncbi_virus_n_field_description:
In the NCBI Virus database, the term "Genotype" refers to the genotype or subtype of a viral sequence, as provided by the sequence submitter. This information is displayed in the Genotype column of the Results Table and can also be used as a filter to refine search results.

The genotype information is parsed from the "/serotype" field of the GenBank record and is shown exactly as it was submitted by the sequence submitter. The presence, accuracy, and consistency of genotype data may vary between records, as it is not a mandatory field in the GenBank submission process.

vjdbv1.0_description: Name of the virus isolate associated with the sample from which the virus sequence was obtained.
ncbi_virus_n_field_description: Isolate or strain name from the "/isolate" field of GenBank record. For more information, see Glossary: Isolate.
ena_erc33_field_description: (Mandatory) Individual isolate from which the sample was obtained

vjdbv1.0_description: Host age given by a number. Is connected to Host Age Unit. The number should match the unit. E.g. 2 years
Unit that describes the host age. Is connected to Host Age. Should fit the number, e.g. 2 years

vjdbv1.0_description: Hash ontent for the rank in the taxonomy tree.
A flag that indicates if the record is the latest update in VirJenDB database
List of VirJenDB metadata fields and their content when they are updated in each release in compare to the previous version
Clear and useful title to identify the analysis of your sequencing experiment. This title will not be submitted to the ENA on submission.
References the Host GTDB Species Name to which the NCBI host taxonomy ID of the virus sequence could be mapped. See the mapping file on the Datasets page.
Virus genome sequence
VIrus genome sequence hash SHA256
Flag indicating yes if the sequence is a representative for a group of identical VirJenDB sequences.
The VirJenDB ID for the unique representative sequence. For the non-phages, the smallest Accession in the group. See documentation for selection details.
Flag indicating yes if the sequence is a representative sequence of a group of sequences, computed by VClust. See documentation for selection details.
The VirJenDB ID of the representative of its cluster. See documentation for selection details.
The tool used to predict the virus sequence. No value means that it is not a predicted virus sequence.
Host Accession from NCBI GenBank that refers to the host sequence from which the prophage was predicted.
Host Assembly Accession of the sequence (INSDC).
The program used for host genome assembly.
References the BioProject Accession associated with the host sequence.
References the BioSample Accession associated with the host sequence.
Country or sea area origin of the sample from which the host sequence originates.
Date of collection of the sample from which the host sequence originates.
Associated Host IMGM Taxon OID from which the virus sequence was extracted by IMG/VR.
phage id internal identifier

vjdbv1.0_description: Average sequencing depth across the host sequence. Multiple host associations/predictions separated by semicolons.
Instrument or sequencing platform used for host sequencing. Multiple host associations/predictions separated by semicolons.
The list of the hash for the lineage of the rank in the ICTV VMR.
Taxonomy Table Hash ID of the Parent Rank
Taxonomy Table Hash ID of the Rank
ICTV Rank Name

IMGVR UVIG ID
True if the current virus sequence is a coding strand. Calculated by part of the ViralClust tool suite. Only intended for ssRNA viruses.

Method by which the fields "Host Accession ID" from NCBI GenBank or "NCBI Taxonomy Lineage" was associated to the virus sequence. Currently (v1.0) either a host association from the data source or PhiSpy prophage prediction. Multiple host associations/predictions separated by semicolons.

Confidence score associated with the method by which "Host Accession ID" from NCBI GenBank or or "NCBI Taxonomy Lineage" was associated to the virus sequence. Multiple host associations/predictions separated by semicolons.
